p: Currently, there are several commercially available EO products which are given to ruminants, including dairy animals, in many parts of the world [ 7, 45, 46, 47]. In general, essential oils have a positive influence when administrated with dairy sheep rations. Adding 1.25 g/kg DM of thyme essential oil improved both ruminal fermentation and nitrogen metabolism [ 48]. Another study investigating the effects of oregano essential oils on sheep showed an increase in the population of three primary cellulosic bacteria and ruminal fungi, affecting the rumen fermentation process [ 49]. However, potential toxic effects of plant essential oils are not scarce and should be taken into consideration before feeding them to animals [ 50].
